key_trio()[source]

This object can be transformed to a dictionary with the ‘.to_dict()’ method. :return: KeyTrio object with ‘private_key’, ‘public_key’ and ‘address’.

send(tx: TransactionV2)[source]

Asynchronous method (used with await). Sends the transaction using the current wallet configuration.

Parameters:

tx – Transaction object.

Returns:

Response from the configured network.

set_network(network: str = 'mainnet', l0_host: str | None = None, l1_host: str | None = None, metagraph_id: str | None = None) → Self[source]

Choose the network and layer associated with the wallet.

Parameters:

  • network – The network API to use with the wallet: “testnet”, “integrationnet”, “mainnet” (default: “mainnet”).

  • metagraph_id – DAG address associated with the metagraph (required if metagraph_id is set).

  • l0_host – IP and PORT or URL associated with the network or metagraph (required if metagraph_id is set), including “http://” or “https://” prefix.

  • l1_host – IP and PORT or URL associated with the network or metagraph (required if metagraph_id is set), including “http://” or “https://” prefix.

Returns:

Configured wallet object.

async transaction(to_address: str, amount: float, fee: float = 0.0) → TransactionV2[source]
Parameters:

  • to_address – The address to receive transaction

  • amount – Quantity to send to the address

  • fee – Tip the network

Returns:

TransactionV2 object
